channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Constant dumping of household rubbish, 14th September
item.description:
Ongoing all the time (months /years), one of the houses along this strip keeps dumping their household rubbish on this section of the pavement instead of using their own front garden and bins. overflowing, piles up throughout the wk, incl dirty nappies etc

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Skipworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Really horrendous, intimidatory flags turning Orpington into Belfast, 14th September
item.description:
It’s just so unsightly. Poorly executed, tantamount to vandalism. Brings the whole area down. No problem people fixing flags to their own property, but this is taking over everyone’s space and intimidates people of colour. Takes us back to the days when the BNP would murder black and Asian teenagers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme wet dog fouling on the pavement which is towards the edge of the pavement. Which is in front of 99Fernhead Road., 14th September
item.description:
Extreme wet dog fouling on the edge of the pavement. Which is in front of 99 Fernhead Road. The fouling has been trodden in! The whole area needs a through wash down! Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Large branches fell from tree on corner of Belmont & Croydon Rds, 14th September
item.description:
2 or 3 large branches broke off the very large old tree on the corner of Belmont Road and Croydon Road during the daytime last Thursday due to strong winds. It was really lucky no-one was hurt, although the bollard was knocked over. The branches were healthy, not rotten, however the tree is very tall and maybe needs a good pruning, bearing in mind this is a busy junction and could be dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Pole, 14th September
item.description:
There's a pole that's been broken for about a month now. Previously another pole was broken, but it got fixed. Then this one happened. It might be the case that it's been mistakenly reported as "fixed" when in fact the second one hasn't been fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Woodland Crescent, East Greenwich, London
